channel.title: Bill S.978 - the end of live streaming and video 'game' recording?
channel.description:
If you are all a fan of seeing or creating video footage on the internet of any sort;
video play through clips live streaming play troughs streaming of tournaments videos of games
Or just any video games over the internet. There is a bill that was created that is currently being debated on. The consequences could be: a 5 year jail sentence or just a money fine (thousands of pounds/dollars).
I don't mean to scare anyone, this could go away and just past through I'm not entirely sure. I thought I might just give you a heads up.
You can watch the video [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hytigOSjJxc]here[/url].
Go HERE to give your opinion on the bill to the US Congress: http://act.demandprogress.org/letter/ten_strikes?akid=700.450896.5hVZPC&r.

item.title: Bill S.978 - the end of live streaming and video 'game' recording?
item.dc:creator: @_Worx `Worx
item.description:
@_Worx wrote:

asyo4:

It isn’t going to get passed.

Lets hope not. I love me my YouTube videos. And you never know, the basis on which they made this bill is perfectly reasonable in Hollywood’s eyes. I hope it doesn’t, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Bill S.978 - the end of live streaming and video 'game' recording?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:19, topic:402709”]You can still do it, you just need full evidence and proof that the original maker(s) of the game gave you rights to record this and post it freely. I’m sure many games will still support you recording, and might have like a copy and paste sort of thing that you just place in the description. Also, on many youtube videos you see that copyright law 1974 or something that gives us the right to use these things. Is this basically voiding it?

Edit:
Just did some research, looks like you’ll need a lawyer if you wanna upload your video >.<
I also found out who supports and opposes this bill.
http://www.opencongress.org/bill/112-s978/money
If you go through the supporters, you’ll see big names such as:
NBC Universal
AT&T
U. S. Chamber of Commerce
Motion Picture Association of America

Those who support this bill are pretty much in the area of books, newspapers, TVs, radio stations and movies theaters/creators.

However, the general idea of those who appose it consist of consumer groups, militias/ ant-government groups, or, what struck me as an advantage, human rights.

This is going to be a close call. I wouldn’t be surprised if this got passed, but also wouldn’t be surprised if this was passed and later voided due to mass upset, protests, etc.[/quote]

Good points, and i also dont see how the us government will be able to determine if you live in the country other than your ip address which they would have to go through some trouble to obtain, not to mention the 100s of millions of people who already post content such as this, so they will have alot on their shoulders if this does get passed. All of that on top of what you pointed out.

Read full topic
item.source: Bill S.978 - the end of live streaming and video 'game' recording?

item.title: Bill S.978 - the end of live streaming and video 'game' recording?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

You can still do it, you just need full evidence and proof that the original maker(s) of the game gave you rights to record this and post it freely. I’m sure many games will still support you recording, and might have like a copy and paste sort of thing that you just place in the description. Also, on many youtube videos you see that copyright law 1974 or something that gives us the right to use these things. Is this basically voiding it?

Edit:
Just did some research, looks like you’ll need a lawyer if you wanna upload your video >.<
I also found out who supports and opposes this bill.
http://www.opencongress.org/bill/112-s978/money
If you go through the supporters, you’ll see big names such as:
NBC Universal
AT&T
U. S. Chamber of Commerce
Motion Picture Association of America

Those who support this bill are pretty much in the area of books, newspapers, TVs, radio stations and movies theaters/creators.

However, the general idea of those who appose it consist of consumer groups, militias/ ant-government groups, or, what struck me as an advantage, human rights.

This is going to be a close call. I wouldn’t be surprised if this got passed, but also wouldn’t be surprised if this was passed and later voided due to mass upset, protests, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Bill S.978 - the end of live streaming and video 'game' recording?
